page.title: 09COMMUNICATIONS
page.content: Colinsburgh has a sub-post office which is contained in half of a shop. There is one post box outside it, from which the mail is collected three times a day- 07.30,11.30 and 16.00 Mondays to Fridays. Saturday collection is at 11.30. Mail is delivered by a postman driving a van and coming from Leven between 07.15 and 08.15 with a second delivery around 11.00. There are no deliveries or collections on certain Monday holidays,Christmas Day or New Year's Day. The franking stamp, which used to be Colinsburgh,Fife is now Edinburgh,Lothian and Fife. There is one public telephone box in the village. The minimum charge for a call is 10p.
